turns.speaker: YORK
turns.text: Nada. No radiation... no movement... nothing.

turns.speaker: ACKLAND
turns.text: Well, just keep looking.  It's gotta be... whoa, Jesus!

turns.speaker: ACKLAND
turns.text: No, it's still breathing.  Kinda clammy though.  Are you sure your stick's not broken.

turns.speaker: ACKLAND
turns.text: God, I hope that thing didn't bring down a virus.

turns.speaker: YORK
turns.text: I told you we... what's that?

turns.speaker: ACKLAND
turns.text: Looks like a spore.  Fungus of some kind, maybe?

turns.speaker: YORK
turns.text: Bloody big if it is.  Top's open.

turns.speaker: YORK
turns.text: Let's get back and call this in.

turns.speaker: BEAUVAIS
turns.text: Good argument for gun-control.  What are you going after, rhino?

turns.speaker: MINH
turns.text: Nah.  I just wanna squeeze off a few rounds.  'Sides, they tagged the rhinos for the migration project, so they're protected.  They'll dock you a month's pay for just mentioning it.

turns.speaker: BEAUVAIS
turns.text: We've got no option.  We're gonna have to get it off.

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: That's the second time I ran it, and it still reads the same.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: A pair of incomings.  They popped-up on the medium-range about thirteen twenty-four local time.

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: We figured on it being a magnetic anomaly, but we ran a back-trace just to make sure.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: Yeah.  Turns out they dropped straight out of hyperspace.

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Can you patch me a temporary loop on DCMGS?

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: A three-second burn to port, on my mark.

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Cassie, thank Christ!  We're under attack.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: How many of them are there?

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: We're not gonna make it, are we?

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: What?  What's wrong?  What is it?

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Quick!  Run a trace on the culvert leading off the auto-shop maintenance pit.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: Drains right into the Central Reservoir.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: I can't reach her.  Too much signal break-up.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: MarsCo went belly-up on the Dow Jones.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: Yesterday.  We got the Network feed from Gateway; it was the top story on 'Sixty Seconds'.  Biggest market crash since twenty-four.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Fucking great.  I invested some money in them.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: You win some, you loose some.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: I lose 'em all, that's why I'm still out here on this rock.  Anything else you wanna ruin my day with?

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: No, but I got something that might interest you.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: Curious thing is, the mass detector says they're too small to carry a deep-space drive.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Sounds like a couple of escape shuttles.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: We ran a trajectory simulation.  If they carry on along that path, it's possible they'll make intra-orbital insertion.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: Seven minutes ago, the third course change in an hour.  Those incomings are going to skim past the communications platform just a little too close for comfort.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Can we move it to a different orbit in time?

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: The door's sealed from inside.  Doc Revna's in there, and it sounds like Ackland's going nuts.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: Unconfirmed reports of eighteen or so far, but the numbers are all over the place.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: Auto-shop's sealed, but those boys are cut-off.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Alright, let's keep calm.  We've got to have an option of some sort... there's got to be a way out of this.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: How much air-time have I got?

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: About thirty minutes.  Those are slimmed-down tanks, so no stopping to admire the scenery.

turns.speaker: CASSIE
turns.text: We've dumped the whole data-base from one of the cleaning remotes into the helmet. It'll project the route through the sewer system onto the inside of the glass as you go.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: If I can get to the chopper, I'll meet you at the rendezvous.  Don't wait for me.

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: One more sweep... one more sweep.  I'm getting tired of one more fuckin' sweep. We're been lookin' for this thing for three days now, and found zip.

turns.speaker: DE VRIES
turns.text: Ah, quit griping.  Keeps you in shape doesn't it?

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: Hey!  I was in shape before we started doing this.

turns.speaker: DE VRIES
turns.text: That's what I mean.  This is the quietest I've ever heard it.  It's unnatural.

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: Next time you have a thought like that? Keep it to yourself.

turns.speaker: DE VRIES
turns.text: That's impossible, man.  This fence is high-tensile.  The breaking tolerance'd stand up to the strain of a rhino, easy. I know, I put it up.

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: There's no way a rhino'd survive that drop.

turns.speaker: DE VRIES
turns.text: Goldsmith's gonna be plenty pissed at losing one of her babies.

turns.speaker: DE VRIES
turns.text: What?  Are you nuts?  Just the two of us?

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: I've seen this mother, De Vries.  We can bag it, no problem.

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: C'mon De Vries.  Think of the bonus.

turns.speaker: DE VRIES
turns.text: Fuck the bonus.  I hate heights.  You wouldn't get me up there even if it wasn't night.

turns.speaker: DE VRIES
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: Hey, fair enough.  If you won't come, I'll handle it myself.

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: It's moving slow.  About... eleven metres. On the left.

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: Just behind us, over to the right.

turns.speaker: DE VRIES
turns.text: Can't see a thing.  Are you sure?

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: I dunno.  Might be a glitch.

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: No, he's stopped; he's totally still. Just take it nice and easy, babe. Nice and easy...

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: Move it baby, or they're gonna be chewin' on my cojones!

turns.speaker: DILLER
turns.text: Miss Noguchi!  You're wanted in admin.

turns.speaker: DILLER
turns.text: York just turned up outside.  We're trying to get him into Infirmary.

turns.speaker: DILLER
turns.text: Secondary fluidic shunt for the sewage system.  I found the grating ripped right off.  The little fucker was strong.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Nobody wander off on their own until it's found.  Keep in pairs. Diller, once the first team's done their sweep I want you to go down with Annie to Three-Pump while she replaces it.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: One final point.  Killing this sonuvabitch ought to be a reward in itself.  However, just to add a little incentive... I'm authorizing a hefty bonus in the next pay-packet for whoever does.

turns.speaker: DRISCOLL
turns.text: Shit!  Our armory's a big blue box from the back shelf of stores.  We got about two clips left for an autoloader, and that's it.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: That sounds promising.  Can we operate the crane from here?

turns.speaker: DRISCOLL
turns.text: Nah.  It's got programmable facilities, but it was never rigged for remote operation.  Someone'd have to go up to the cab to get it up and running.

turns.speaker: DRISCOLL
turns.text: Yeah, I stripped down a motion tracker and hardwired it through to the helmet pick-ups, too.  That's also on the display.

turns.speaker: DRISCOLL
turns.text: We had to.  They were just too cumbersome for some of the conduits you're gonna have to negotiate.  Besides, all the crap floating around reduces visibility to the extent where I doubt having helmet lights would have make that much difference, anyway.  Maintenance lights down there oughta be enough to do the trick.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Hey, Jan.  See if you can get someone to check out the chopper.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: She was running a little sluggish on the way back.  Think the turbines might be playing up.

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: Give me twenty minutes and I'll do it myself.

turns.speaker: GUTTIEREZ
turns.text: And, nothing.  They checked out just fine.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Have you got an updated Lloyds' Almanac to cross-reff them through?

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Fort Powell.  What do we tell 'em?

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Just give them the facts.  They can leap to their own conclusions.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Get off an all-bands emergency distress, and put it on a repeater.

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Punch me in a solution for their delta-vee.

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: It left a melted trail on the deck all the way down to here...

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Central Pumping.  All the waste gets  treated, broken-down, and flushed out into the swamp.  If it wanted a quick exit then it really lucked- out.

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Everything on this module is locked and sealed.  We've lost 'B', 'C', and 'E' wings, but 'E' was the only one we didn't manage to totally evacuate.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: How many... how many people are missing?

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: They knocked out the external feeds.

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Communications to auto-shop go through an F.O. link off the main trunk. That's down with the other feeds.

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: It's not all good news.  We had to take off the helmet lights.  You'll be going in blind.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Forget it.  I wouldn't ask somebody to do something I wouldn't do myself.  Where's the disk?

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Let's just run through it one more time so I know you've got it straight.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Okay, I pull the access panel off of the console.  Insert the disk, and press the green enabling button...

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Right.  When you've done that, don't waste any time getting out of there.  Once that crane starts moving...well, it's bound to provoke some kind of response.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: See that sheathing on the suspension? Eaten away.  Same thing with the pumps on the base air purifiers.  The algae out here just isn't good on these new plastics.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: We haven't used Big Bertha since we relocated the generator module. That was four months ago.  I can't ask for them to keep bringing spares in on the shuttle, it's already costing too much as it is.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Hey, boss.  Wondered where you'd gotten to.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: I just... wanted to be put on my own for a while.  Clear my head.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Didn't feel like whoopin' it up with the rest of us blue collars, huh?

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: I've got a lot of thinking to do.  'Sides, the room was getting too crowded for me.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Not too much of the socializing type, then?

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: No, not really.  More sort of the  'claustrophobic' type.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: I'm serious.  That's why I switched from orbiting to planetary installations.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Uh-huh.  Used to get it pretty bad.  I'd wake up in a cold sweat and want to claw open a vacuum hatch.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: How long you been out here for now, anyway?  Three months?

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Just curious.  There's a lot of talk goes around.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Nothing.  With the satellite down, we can't transmit over the mountain range. He's most likely sitting there wondering why he can't raise us.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: First light, we'll take a chopper out there and tell them to head back.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: 'We'?  You wanna fly out there with me?

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Sure.  Do me good to stretch my legs.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  If the Network goes by the book, like everyone figures they will, a Marine gunboat from Powell'll drop-by for a look- see in four-or-five days.  They can go poke around out there and find whatever it was hit us.  All we've gotta do is sit tight.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Do you think Ackland'll sit tight?

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: There'd have to be a helluva good reason for him not to.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: I'm going to need you to co-sign the report.  Until we come up with something, this'll be treated as first degree murder.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: When we get the link back, and I send this in, I.C.C.'ll throw a fit.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Ah, don't worry about I.C.C.  They're the least of your problems right now.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Again?  How long before we start noticing the difference?

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Ackland?  I don't know him well enough to say.  If we were back on Earth we could run him though an Aldhoven test and find out for sure. There's not much we can do out here.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Cornering it shouldn't be a problem.  Each part of this station is basically a self-sufficient deep-space transport module running off external couplers.  If we disconnect them and seal off every section, we've got a ceiling of about thirty-six hours on internal power.  That should give us ample time to find it.

turns.speaker: HIROKO
turns.text: Alright.  Pull some trackers and headsets out of stores, and I'll sign a release for the weapons.  Cassie, organise a team roster and put it on the board.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: What do I think?  I think if those Marines from Powell don't shift their butts getting here, we're gonna get caught up to our necks in the middle of something we shouldn't.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: I'm out of ammo.  Get inside, get inside!

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: They...they snapped my legs to fit... fit me in here.  I don't...remember what happened next.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: I can... feel it moving around inside me. You've got to kill me.

turns.speaker: KAMEN
turns.text: Camped out by the navi-beacon out on Linson's Range.  They're making their own way back tomorrow.

turns.speaker: PARSONS
turns.text: Yeah, exactly.  Those're pre-programmed course adjustments you're looking at.
